com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Order

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.CwObject
          com.conceptwave.scripting.OrderItem
              com.conceptwave.scripting.OrderGroup
                  com.conceptwave.scripting.Order

public class Order
extends OrderGroup

Order class. The order is hierarchical structure of order items which can be order groups, collections and documents. Each of these objects belong to Order class - i.e. the expression 'obj instanceof Order' will return true. For the Document objects the expression 'doc instanceof Document' will return true only if the document is not part of order. If the order contains a single document collection called "ShoppingBasket" and the collection document is dynamic document the collection is a Basket object.

Field Detail

dirty

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean dirty
READONLY: Flag indicating that the order is new or has data that has not been saved.

getOrderState

public String getOrderState
READONLY: Returns the current order state. The method may be called on any order item in the order.

optimizedSave

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean optimizedSave
WRITEONLY: Sets the optimized saves flag on an order

orderInstance

public Document orderInstance
READONLY: Returns the order instance document.

state

public String state
READWRITE: Returns the current order state. The method may be called on any order item in the order. Throws exception if the current object is not part of order. Sets the current order state and store it immediately in the database.

Constructor Detail

Order

public Order(String metadataType)
Creates a new order of specified metadata type

Parameters:
metadataType - String The fully qualified metadata order name
Method Detail

_delete

public void _delete()
Deprecated. As of 4.1-SP2. Use 'deleteOrder'.

Deletes the order from the Order database. Because 'delete' is a keyword in JavaScript and for compatibility with previous version the function name starts with underscore.

changeLogOff

public void changeLogOff()
Turns off the order change log facility. The changes in the order content will not be logged any more.

changeLogOn

public void changeLogOn()
Turns on the order change log facility for the current order. Any changes in the order content, for the leafs having the audit on, will be logged in the change log table (not in audit log table).

copyOrder

public Order copyOrder(com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean storeTheCopy,
                       com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean copyOrderInstance)
Copy the order and optionally store the copy in the database.

Parameters:
storeTheCopy - If true the copy is stored in the database.
copyOrderInstance - If true, copy also the OrderInstance document.
Returns:
Copied order

createOrderItemByPath

public OrderItem createOrderItemByPath(String dataPath,
                                       com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean initialize)
Creates an order item by data path. All intermediate items along the path are created if they don't exist.

Parameters:
dataPath - Order item data path. Metadata name of the item to be created and all parent items up to the current order item separated by period.
initialize - If true the created item is initialized
Returns:
The newly created order item.

deleteOrder

public void deleteOrder()
Deletes the order from the Order database.

getLog

public Array getLog(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer logType)
Gets all the memory changes from the moment startLogging was called

Parameters:
logType - 0 - Added Items, 1 - Deleted Items, 2 - Updated Items. If any other value return null.
Returns:
If logType = 0/1, the number of items returned is the number of times method newInstance()/deleteItem() called; If logType = 2, the number of items returned may be less than the number of times the order item documents get updated

getOrderById

public static Order getOrderById(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object ordId,
                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Object throwException,
                                 Date creationDate,
                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Object bulkLoad)
Read an order from the database with a given ID.

Parameters:
ordId - Order ID.
throwException - If not specified or "true" an exception will be thrown if the order is not found. If the parameter is boolean value false and the order is not found the returned value will be null.
creationDate - If specified is passed to the database to use the proper partition. Optional if the order tables are not partitioned
bulkLoad - If true the value the order will be load in bulk mode - i.e. the API will take more time and memory but will reduce considerably the database access as the order items are accessed. Use the bulk flag only if majority of the order or embedded basket items are to be accessed. If the parameter is not a Boolean value or is null or not specified it is considered false.
Returns:
Order read from the database or null (only if the throwException parameter is false).

getOrderInstance

public static Document getOrderInstance(String ordId)
Returns the order instance document for a given order id. Throws exception if there is no order with such id in the order database.

Parameters:
ordId - The order id.
Returns:
The order instance document.

getOrderItemByPath

public OrderItem getOrderItemByPath(String dataPath)
Gets an order item by path. Returns null if the object is not order item or if the item does not exist.

Parameters:
dataPath - Order item data path. Metadata name of the item to be returned and all parent items up to the current order item separated by period.
Returns:
The order item for the path or null if not existing or the object is not order item.

getVisualKeyDocument

public Document getVisualKeyDocument()
Gets order instance document to be used for visual key

Overrides:
getVisualKeyDocument in class OrderGroup
Returns:
Document or null if there is no instance document defined or it is missing

purge

public void purge()
Delete order from database and delete all processes associated with this order.

read

public static Order read(String type,
                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object ordId,
                         Date creationDate,
                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object bulkLoad)
Reads an order from the database.

Parameters:
type - - fully qualified order type or null. If the type is not null the order must have this type type.
ordId - The order id object. May be string or reference.
creationDate - If specified is passed to the database to use the proper partition. Optional if the order tables are not partitioned
bulkLoad - If true the value the order will be load in bulk mode - i.e. the API will take more time and memory but will reduce considerably the database access as the order items are accessed. Use the bulk flag only if majority of the order or embedded basket items are to be accessed. If the parameter is not a Boolean value or is null or not specified it is considered false.
Returns:
The order or null if the order is not found or is not of the specified type.

readItem

public static OrderItem readItem(String type,
                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Object ordId,
                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Object bulkLoad)
Reads an order item by id from the database. If the order item is found the whole order is read from the database and the corresponding order item is returned. If an order item path is specified returns null if the order item does not match the specified path.

Parameters:
type - - metadata order path or null. The metadata order path consists of fully specified metadata order name, followed by the metadata names of the parent items down to the specified item separated by periods. If the type is not null the order item with this id must have this metadata order path.
ordId - The order item id. May be string or reference.
bulkLoad - If true the value the order will be load in bulk mode - i.e. the API will take more time and memory but will reduce considerably the database access as the order items are accessed. Use the bulk flag only if majority of the order or embedded basket items are to be accessed. If the parameter is not a Boolean value or is null or not specified it is considered false.
Returns:
The order item or null if the order is not found or does not contain the specified metadata order path.

rollbackLoggedData

public void rollbackLoggedData()
Rollbacks all the memory changes done from the moment startLogging was called

save

public void save()
Saves all changed documents of the order in the Order database.

startLogging

public void startLogging()
Starts to log changes to the order in the memory

stopLogging

public void stopLogging()
Stops memory loging and removes the log
